questions.question: What is a comma splice?

choices.answer: A run-on sentence separated by only a comma
Two independent clauses separated by only a comma
An independent and subordinate clause separated by a comma
None of the above

questions.question: In what ways can you fix a comma splice?

choices.answer: Change the sentence structure
Use a conjunction (and, or, but, yet, soâ€¦)
Separate the two sentences with a period
All of the above

questions.question: Comma splices contain two stand-alone sentences, inadequately joined to make one.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What are the similarities between run-ons sentences and comma splices?

choices.answer: They contain two independent clauses w/ incorrect puncuation
You can correct them with adding a conjunction.
They can be corrected by separating the two clauses.
All of the above

questions.question: Correct the sentence: "Lindzy didn't want to play, we watched cartoons."

choices.answer: Lindzy didn't want to play, so we watched cartoons.
Lindzy didn't want to play; we watched cartoons.
Lindzy didn't want to play. We watched cartoons.
All are correct

questions.question: Which sentence below contains a comma splice?

choices.answer: Mr. Daniel, our choir teacher, will pick our play theme.
Your cousin is flying in, I also heard your aunt was here.
Gordon will be in the NBA this season, and he will be good.
Quinton took his dog on a walk, and later gave him a bath.

questions.question: Correct the sentence: There was an accident on 411 last night, many got hurt.

choices.answer: There was an accident on 411 last night; many got hurt.
There was an accident on 411 last night, and many got hurt.
There was an accident on 411 last night, so many got hurt.
All three are correct

questions.question: Select the sentence that is not a comma splice.

choices.answer: Our boss is a hard man, he is also fair.
Brussell sprouts are good for you, but they taste bad.
It barely rained all winter, I needed to water the garden.
My husky is a sweetheart, he likes to jump over our fence.

questions.question: John is always late for work, nobody ever cares.

choices.answer: Comma Splice
Complete Sentence

questions.question: The air conditioner is too loud, Cleo can't sleep.

choices.answer: Comma Splice
Complete Sentence

questions.question: Which sentence contains a comma splice?

choices.answer: Painting is fun, so my sister bought me some supplies.
Her cat got out of her house, and she had to run after it.
Steven didn't want to go, he hated the museum
He wanted a chocolate cake, but she wanted vanilla.

questions.question: Is this a comma splice? "He wanted to go swimming at the lake, but his mom told him no.

choices.answer: Yes
No

questions.question: Correct the sentence: "The peacock flew into our tree, it looked at us and squawked.

choices.answer: The peacock flew into our tree and squawked at us.
The peacock squawked at us and flew into the tree.
As the peacock flew into our tree, it squawked at us.
All three are correct

questions.question: Which is not a comma splice?

choices.answer: My mom likes Star Wars, my dad lies Star Trek.
The waves at the beach were loud, but we didn't mind.
We went to Walmart to shop, we also went to Target.
I've never been on a plane, I've never gone on a cruise.

questions.question: Is this a comma splice? "We went to the movies, we got popcorn and drinks.

choices.answer: Yes
No

questions.question: Correct the sentence: I did not like the ride, it was way too short.

choices.answer: I did not like the ride. It was way too short.
I did not like the ride. And it was way too short.
I did not like the ride: it was way too short
All are correct

questions.question: Correct the sentence:  I love to bake, my favorite thing to bake is cookies.

choices.answer: I love to bake, but my favorite thing to bake is cookies.
I love to bake; my favorite thing to bake is cookies.
I love to bake and my favorite thing to bake is cookies.
Both answers 1 and 2

questions.question: Correct the sentence: Rachel rides the subway to work, walking takes too long.

choices.answer: Rachel rides the subway to work; walking takes too long.
Correct as is
Rachel rides the subway to work as walking takes too long.
Rachel rides the subway to work. But walking takes too long.

questions.question: Correct the sentence with the best answer: Running is a great workout, it keeps me in shape.

choices.answer: Running is a great workout. It keeps me in shape.
Running is a great workout; but it keeps me in shape.
Correct as is
Running is a great workout and it keeps me in shape.

questions.question: Find the sentence that does not contain a comma splice

choices.answer: Science is Sasha's favorite subject, but she also likes art.
The fish swam towards the ocean, but they turned back.
The game was close, but my favorite team won.
All are correct
